member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.Elements.TagInfo
member.summary: This class is used to store information about the kind of element.
member.remarks: It is used internally to control the formatting behavior. Externally it is used to provide such information for plug-in modules.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatter
member.summary: The HtmlFormatter formats a HTML stream into XHTML format and indent the element in a functional related way, e.g. it recognizes tables and can distinguish between inline and block tags.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatter.AddCustomElement(GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.Elements.ITagInfo)
member.summary: This method adds a new TagInfo object to the collection of TagInfos. These collection is used to format any registered tag correctly. All tag known in HTML 4.0 are predefined. The Plug-In module uses this method to enhance the know tags.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatter.#cctor
member.summary: This static constructor builds the replacement table for entities and defines the type of HTML tags that the formatter recognizes to build a functional related tree for output.

member.summary:
This function filters out unwanted html tags from a html string. It also empties tags of any attributes, e.g.

becomes
member.param: The HTML fragment to work on
An array of strings, each representing a html tag, e.g. "a","img", etc.
member.returns: Returns the clean HTML as string.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions
member.summary: Formatter options used to determine the overall behavior of the formatter class.
member.remarks: The formatter will analyse and refresh the content to beeing HTML 4/XHTML compliant. This changes the indentation, quotes and newlines. The formatter does not allow any code preservation.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Standard constructor to build default formatter options.
member.remarks:
This constructor sets the folowing default options:
IndentChar = ' ' (space)

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.#ctor(System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Standard constructor to build formatter options with the minimum number of parameters needed.
member.param: Number of chars the indent char is repeated each level

member.summary: Advanced constructor to build formatter options with the minimum number of parameters needed.
member.param: Number of chars the indent char is repeated each level
true makes all attributes upper case
true makes all elements upper case

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.#ctor(System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32,GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterCase,GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterCase,System.Boolean,GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.EntityFormat)
member.summary: Advanced constructor to build formatter options with the minimum number of parameters needed.
member.param: Number of chars the indent char is repeated each level
true makes all attributes upper case

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.ToString
member.summary: Support a text for the propertygrid.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.CommentCDATAAddsNewline
member.summary: After CDATA and before ending a newline is added autoamtically.
member.remarks: By default there is no newline added.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.FakeEmptyParaTag
member.summary: Empty P Tags do not render properly in MSHTML. To fix this option adds   between.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.PreserveWhitespace
member.summary: Indicates whether whitespaces (space, newline, tab) should be preserved, if possible. Default is false.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.ReformatStyles
member.summary: Reformats the CSS in attributes and style tags to remove unneccessary spaces. Default is false.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.CommentCDATA
member.summary: Gets or sets the ability to add JavaScript comments before CDATA token.
member.remarks:
The XHTML module wraps JavaScript code into <![CDATA[ ]]> sections. Some script processors have problems reading this. To avoid any scripting issues this option can set to true and the formatter will add // sign in front of <![CDATA[ ]]>:
<script> //<![CDATA[ Script goes here //]]> </script>
Default setting is false (option not being used).
The used string for comment signs defaults to "//". The value can be changed using .

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.CommentCDATAString
member.summary: The string value used if the formatter needs to add comments before CDATA tokens.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.WordClean
member.summary: Gets or sets the ability to clean MS Word styles.
member.remarks:
MS Word produces some weird output when content was saved as HTML. If such content was loaded or dropped this formatting feature can strip out the most of the non HTML 4/XHTML 1 compliant code.
The value defaults to false and must set explicitly.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.AttributeCasing
member.summary: Set the case of attributes. If true all attribute names are upper case.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.Entities
member.summary: Determines how entities are treaten.
member.remarks: The entities are built as &name; variant by default, if any known entity exists. Otherwise any enhanced ASCII or unicode character will be replaced by the numeric expression &#NNN;.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.ElementCasing
member.summary: Set the case of element names. If true all element names are upper case.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.IndentChar
member.summary: Determines the char used to build indentation.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.IndentSize
member.summary: Determines the number of chars used for each indentation level. Use 1 for tabs and 4 to 8 for whitespace.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.MakeXhtml
member.summary: If true the output conforms to XHTML 1.0, otherwise to HTML 4.0 If input is XHTML compliant the output will never changed back to HTML 4.0 regardless this option.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlFormatterOptions.MaxLineLength
member.summary: Forces a line break after leaving the given number of columns per line.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer
member.summary: This class creates a stream of tokens from the input string. The tokens control how the formatter will place the elements in line or on a new line and how to indent.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.GetFirstToken(System.Char[])
member.summary: Start search for the first token with the current content. The content comes in array of char, which is build in the class.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.GetFirstToken(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Start with the first token at a specific position.
member.param: Current State from which the token is searched.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.GetNextToken(GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.Token)
member.summary: The next token in the stream

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.GetNextToken(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The next token within the stream from a given start position and state. The tokenizer loops through the chars and determines the next token based on the given state and an "expected" state (Exp = expected). If the expected state is recognized, the token is build, otherwise the search goes further until the current state is completely resolved or an error is thrown.
member.param: Length, number of chars to beeing searched.
Start index, point from which the search starts.
The current state of the tokenizer.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.IsWhitespace(System.Char)
member.summary: Checks the char is a whitespace.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.IsWordChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Checks the char is a word character, which is a letter, a digit or one of the characters '_' (underline), ':' (colon), '#' (hash sign), '-' (minus sign), '*' (asterisk), '.' (dot), and '^'.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.IndexOf(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Searches for a specific character or string within the chars array from a specific position and to a specific position.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.HtmlTokenizer.HtmlTokenizerStates
member.summary: The Tokenizer codes to set the state of the currently found or checked character state.
